Reason: The configuration option 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the garbage collection process. A lower threshold may lead to more frequent garbage collection cycles, increasing CPU usage and potentially causing performance degradation. On the other hand, a higher threshold may delay garbage collection, leading to increased memory consumption and potential out-of-memory errors. Therefore, changes in this configuration can significantly affect system performance in terms of execution time and memory consumption.
